purpose: The code appears to collect system information including MAC addresses, hostname, and user info, then sends this data to external domains via HTTP requests.
flows: MAC addresses collected -> base64 encoded -> sent to external domain
Hostname collected -> sent to external domain
User info collected -> sent to external domain
anomalies: Use of hardcoded external domains that appear to be part of a tracking or monitoring service
Sending system identifiers to external servers without user consent
analysis: This code collects sensitive system information such as MAC addresses, hostname, and user details. It then sends this data to known tracking domains through HTTP requests with disabled SSL verification. This behavior is highly indicative of telemetry or data collection functionality often found in malware or spyware. The hardcoded domain names suggest it's communicating with a specific third-party service.
conclusion: This code exhibits characteristics of malicious telemetry or data collection software with high probability.
